Introduction

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd

Setup 

options(max.print = 500)

library(tiledbsoma)
library(fs)
library(tiledb)
library(SeuratObject)
#> Attaching sp

data_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "pbmc_small")
dir.create(data_dir, showWarnings = FALSE)

Overview

This vignette will cover the creation of an SOMACollection from a Seurat object.

Load data

Load the subsetted 10X genomics PBMC dataset provided by SeuratObject.

data("pbmc_small", package = "SeuratObject")
pbmc_small
#> An object of class Seurat 
#> 230 features across 80 samples within 1 assay 
#> Active assay: RNA (230 features, 20 variable features)
#>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, tsne

Convert a Seurat object to a TileDB-backed SOMACollection

The SOMACollection class provides a method for converting an entire Seurat object to an SOMACollection. This is the recommended way to perform the conversion since it can handle multiple Assay objects and will (eventually) convert all of the standard slots that comprise a Seurat object.

This first step is to create a new SOMACollection object and provide a URI where the dataset should be created:

soco <- SOMACollection$new(uri = file.path(tempdir(), "soco"))
#> No SOMACollection currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco'
#> Creating new SOMACollection at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco'
#> No TileDBGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/uns'
#> Creating new TileDBGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/uns'

Next, we’ll pass the entire pbmc_small object directly to from_seurat() and one SOMA will be created for each Assay object:

soco$from_seurat(object = pbmc_small)
#> No SOMA currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA'
#> Creating new SOMA at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obs'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/var'
#> No AssayMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X'
#> Creating new AssayMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varm'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsp'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varp'
#> No TileDBGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/uns'
#> Creating new TileDBGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/uns'
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obs'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obs
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/var'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/var
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/counts'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [obs_id,var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/counts'
#> Ingesting AssayMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/counts
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [obs_id,var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/data'
#> Ingesting AssayMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/data
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/scale.data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [obs_id,var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/scale.data'
#> Ingesting AssayMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/scale.data
#> Finished converting Seurat Assay with key [rna_] to SOMA
#> No AnnotationMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrix array with index [var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Ingesting AnnotationMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca
#> No AnnotationMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrix array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Ingesting AnnotationMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca
#> No AnnotationMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrix array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne'
#> Ingesting AnnotationMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsp/graph_snn'
#> as(<dgCMatrix>, "dgTMatrix") is deprecated since Matrix 1.5-0; do as(., "TsparseMatrix") instead
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrix array with index [obs_id_i,obs_id_j] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsp/graph_snn'
#> Ingesting AnnotationPairwiseMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsp/graph_snn
#> No CommandsArray found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/uns/commands'
#> Creating new CommandsArray array with index [index] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/uns/commands'
#> Ingesting CommandsArray data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/uns/commands
#> Finished converting Seurat object to SOMACollection

Examining the directory structure, you can see the top-level SOMACollection directory now contains a single soma_RNA sub-directory, corresponding to pbmc_small’s only assay, "RNA":

fs::dir_tree(soco$uri, recurse = 1)
#> /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco
#> ├── __group
#> │   ├── __1663954416767_1663954416767_47829ca005614bf5a145315e73074a3f
#> │   └── __1663954417032_1663954417032_cf861def4f4b4354b603b3990f778da0
#> ├── __meta
#> │   └── __1663954416738_1663954416738_013450d5700947d0a268d8323432e441
#> ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── soma_RNA
#> │   ├── X
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> │   ├── obs
#> │   ├── obsm
#> │   ├── obsp
#> │   ├── uns
#> │   ├── var
#> │   ├── varm
#> │   └── varp
#> └── uns
#>     ├── __group
#>     ├── __meta
#>     ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#>     └── commands

Internally, the SOMACollection class is used to convert each Seurat Assay object to a SOMA, which creates and populates the various sub-components, including:

  • the counts, data, and scale.data matrices are each stored in separate attribute of the X array
  • the data.frame containing feature-level metadata is ingested into the var array

Separately, any dimensional reductions are extracted and stored in corresponding obsm/varm arrays.

To close the loop we can then read the on-disk SOMACollection back into memory as a Seurat object.

soco$to_seurat(project = "SOCO Example")
#> Reading AssayMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/counts'
#> Reading AssayMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/data'
#> Reading AssayMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/X/scale.data'
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/var'
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obs'
#> Found 2 dim reduction arrays
#> Reading AnnotationMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Reading AnnotationMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/varm/dimreduction_pca'
#> Found 1 dim reduction arrays
#> Reading AnnotationMatrix into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsm/dimreduction_tsne'
#> Reading AnnotationPairwiseMatrix into dataframe from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obsp/graph_snn'
#> Reading command history into memory
#> An object of class Seurat 
#> 230 features across 80 samples within 1 assay 
#> Active assay: RNA (230 features, 20 variable features)
#>  2 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, tsne

Convert a Seurat Assay to TileDB-backed SOMA

Conversions can happen at multiple levels of the API. For example, we can operate directly on a Seurat Assay using SOMA. The workflow is largely the same:

soma <- SOMA$new(uri = file.path(tempdir(), "soma"))
#> No SOMA currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma'
#> Creating new SOMA at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obs'
#> No AnnotationDataframe found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/var'
#> No AssayMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X'
#> Creating new AssayMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obsm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obsm'
#> No AnnotationMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/varm'
#> Creating new AnnotationMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/varm'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obsp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obsp'
#> No AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/varp'
#> Creating new AnnotationPairwiseMatrixGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/varp'
#> No TileDBGroup currently exists at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/uns'
#> Creating new TileDBGroup at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/uns'
fs::dir_tree(soma$uri)
#> /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma
#> ├── X
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   │   └── __1663954418582_1663954418582_a08259dc9a504f68a6efbe2b931bbcca
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── __group
#> │   ├── __1663954418591_1663954418591_206ae8bf782f4887bcf7a80a6f65a82b
#> │   ├── __1663954418605_1663954418605_6aa752faeb2544eaa1f6ca1fd2809d9f
#> │   ├── __1663954418619_1663954418619_fd5e0dab68334d9f823fcfa91f0734fb
#> │   ├── __1663954418633_1663954418633_0ea63ef339b94fdab26b240619ffdc39
#> │   ├── __1663954418647_1663954418647_45ea28f8968147e0aea5c6047699a6d0
#> │   └── __1663954418660_1663954418660_d1a7304e07ce4239837978f17a670c06
#> ├── __meta
#> │   └── __1663954418500_1663954418500_c6e0ec69133e42d0b924aad5868f4efa
#> ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── obsm
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   │   └── __1663954418597_1663954418597_9295ff6091b245c783aac3c574f0ee77
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── obsp
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   │   └── __1663954418625_1663954418625_f5d7b6922d654703b29e49995ea3cc78
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── uns
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   │   └── __1663954418652_1663954418652_06d81a10536d478f838990f14088f19c
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── varm
#> │   ├── __group
#> │   ├── __meta
#> │   │   └── __1663954418611_1663954418611_64987aaddc144710afb9dda92c9c6ccd
#> │   └── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> └── varp
#>     ├── __group
#>     ├── __meta
#>     │   └── __1663954418639_1663954418639_2a42b19afdc0470a92022f1a4a539df5
#>     └── __tiledb_group.tdb

Then we’ll pass RNA assay from pbmc_small to the from_seurat_assay() method of the SOMA class.

Note: Because cell-level metadata is stored in the parent Seurat object, we need to provide this data separately.

soma$from_seurat_assay(
  object = pbmc_small[["RNA"]],
  obs = pbmc_small[[]]
)
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [obs_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obs'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/obs
#> Creating new AnnotationDataframe array with index [var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/var'
#> Ingesting AnnotationDataframe data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/var
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/counts'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [obs_id,var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/counts'
#> Ingesting AssayMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/counts
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [obs_id,var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/data'
#> Ingesting AssayMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/data
#> No AssayMatrix found at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/scale.data'
#> Creating new AssayMatrix array with index [obs_id,var_id] at '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/scale.data'
#> Ingesting AssayMatrix data into: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma/X/scale.data
#> Finished converting Seurat Assay with key [rna_] to SOMA

Examine the directory structure of the soma we can see the X, var, and obs arrays have all been created.

fs::dir_tree(soma$uri, recurse = FALSE)
#> /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soma
#> ├── X
#> ├── __group
#> ├── __meta
#> ├── __tiledb_group.tdb
#> ├── obs
#> ├── obsm
#> ├── obsp
#> ├── uns
#> ├── var
#> ├── varm
#> └── varp

Accessing individual components

Any of the underlying TileDB arrays can be accessed directly from a SOMACollection object by navigating its internal classes.

As an example, let’s access the cell-level metadata. Recall from the SOMA spec that cell-level metadata is stored in the obs array of an SOMA. Therefore, we must first access a specific SOMA within the SOMACollection’s somas slot. Let’s generate a list of the available SOMAs:

names(soco$somas)
#> [1] "RNA"

Easy choice. "RNA" can then be used to index the corresponding SOMA:

soco$members$RNA
#> <SOMA>
#>   uri: /tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA 
#>   arrays: obs, var 
#>   groups: obsm, obsp, uns, varm, varp, X

We can see we have access to a variety of fields and methods, but obs is the one we’re after.

soco$members$RNA$obs$to_dataframe()
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obs'

#> GGGTAACTCTAGTG             A     g2             2            2
#> GGTGGAGATTACTC             A     g1             0            0
#> GTAAGCACTCATTC             A     g2             2            2
#>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 18 rows ]

This is a AnnotationDataframe object, which includes a method for reading the data into R as a data.frame:

head(soco$members$RNA$obs$to_dataframe())
#> Reading AnnotationDataframe into memory from '/tmp/RtmpDoPp7g/soco/soma_RNA/obs'
#>                   orig.ident nCount_RNA nFeature_RNA RNA_snn_res.0.8
#> AAATTCGAATCACG SeuratProject        327           62               1
#> AAGCAAGAGCTTAG SeuratProject        126           48               0
#> AAGCGACTTTGACG SeuratProject        443           77               1
#> AATGCGTGGACGGA SeuratProject        389           73               1
#> AATGTTGACAGTCA SeuratProject        100           41               0
#> ACAGGTACTGGTGT SeuratProject        151           59               0
#>                letter.idents groups RNA_snn_res.1 active_ident
#> AAATTCGAATCACG             B     g2             1            1
#> AAGCAAGAGCTTAG             A     g1             0            0
#> AAGCGACTTTGACG             B     g1             1            1
#> AATGCGTGGACGGA             B     g1             1            1
#> AATGTTGACAGTCA             A     g1             0            0
#> ACAGGTACTGGTGT             A     g1             0            0

Array Access

Helpers

All of the array-based classes include a number of helper functions for interacting with the underlying arrays.

Print the schema of an array:

soma_obs <- soco$members$RNA$obs
soma_obs$schema()
#> tiledb_array_schema(
#>     domain=tiledb_domain(c(tiledb_dim(name="obs_id", domain=c(NULL,NULL), tile=NULL, type="ASCII"))),
#>     attrs=c(tiledb_attr(name="orig.ident", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="nCount_RNA", type="FLOAT64", ncells=1, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="nFeature_RNA", type="INT32", ncells=1, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="RNA_snn_res.0.8", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="letter.idents", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="groups", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="RNA_snn_res.1", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))), tiledb_attr(name="active_ident", type="ASCII", ncells=NA, nullable=FALSE, filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1))))),
#>     cell_order="ROW_MAJOR", tile_order="ROW_MAJOR", capacity=256, sparse=TRUE, allows_dups=FALSE,
#>     coords_filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1))),
#>     offsets_filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("ZSTD"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1))),
#>     validity_filter_list=tiledb_filter_list(c(tiledb_filter_set_option(tiledb_filter("RLE"),"COMPRESSION_LEVEL",-1)))
#> )

List the names of the array’s dimensions (i.e., indexed columns)

soma_obs$dimnames()
#> [1] "obs_id"

and attributes (i.e., non-indexed columns):

soma_obs$attrnames()
#> [1] "orig.ident"      "nCount_RNA"      "nFeature_RNA"    "RNA_snn_res.0.8"
#> [5] "letter.idents"   "groups"          "RNA_snn_res.1"   "active_ident"

TileDB API access

You can also use the tiledb_array() method to directly access the underlying arrays using the standard TileDB API, providing the full functionality of the tiledb package. For example, let’s query the obs array and retrieve a subset of cells that match our QC criteria:

obs_array <- soma_obs$tiledb_array(
  return_as = "tibble",
  attrs = c("nCount_RNA", "nFeature_RNA"),
  query_condition = parse_query_condition(nFeature_RNA < 2500)
)

obs_array[]
#> # A tibble: 80 × 3
#>    obs_id         nCount_RNA nFeature_RNA
#>    <chr>               <dbl>        <int>
#>  1 AAATTCGAATCACG        327           62
#>  2 AAGCAAGAGCTTAG        126           48
#>  3 AAGCGACTTTGACG        443           77
#>  4 AATGCGTGGACGGA        389           73
#>  5 AATGTTGACAGTCA        100           41
#>  6 ACAGGTACTGGTGT        151           59
#>  7 ACCAGTGAATACCG        417           75
#>  8 ACGTGATGCCATGA        709           94
#>  9 ACTCGCACGAAAGT        231           49
#> 10 AGAGATGATCTCGC        191           61
#> # … with 70 more rows
